abstract: United Nations human rights committee calls on Ireland to lift its ban on abortions in cases of fatal fetal abnormalities; recommends country provide compensation to Amanda Mellet, who was forced to travel to England to terminate her nonviable pregnancy; abortion rights advocates hope ruling will compel country to repeal constitutional abortion ban.
lead_paragraph: The case centered on a Dublin woman who traveled abroad to terminate her pregnancy after being told her fetus had severe congenital defects.

headline.main: Ireland Abortion Ban Violated Woman’s Human Rights, U.N. Panel Says
headline.print_headline: U.N. Rights Panel Faults Ireland’s Abortion Ban

snippet: The case centered on a Dublin woman who traveled abroad to terminate her pregnancy after being told her fetus had severe congenital defects.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
